evidence_span: The effect of temperature on accelerated or "breakaway" growth is two-fold: (1) increasing the temperature reduces the incubation period before "breakaway" growth occurs; (2) increasing the temperature increases the final rate of accelerated growth.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk9
evidence_span: There is a strong inverse grain size dependence for growth in materials exhibiting accelerated irradiation growth.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk10
evidence_span: creep property of cladding material is one of the most important factors to estimate fuel performance

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk10
evidence_span: Zircaloy cladding is stressed by coolant pressure and creeps down until it contacts with fuel pellets

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk10
evidence_span: After the contact the cladding is stressed by fuel pellets from inside and may be deformed so as to increase the diameter in case of power ramps

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk10
evidence_span: It may also be stressed from inside by fission product gas released from fuel pellets in extended burn-up conditions

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk10
evidence_span: Lucas and Pelloux [7] showed that creep deformation of stress-relieved Zircaloy-2 plate under variable conditions does not follow a time-hardening rule but that it can be described by a strain-hardening rule

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk10
evidence_span: They also suggested that an explicit treatment of recovery rate might be necessary for accurate creep
